The appellant's complaint is maintainable as it has been obtained by fraud.

summary: The Supreme Court of India has set aside the conviction and sentence of Sukh Dev Raj Sodhi in a 2002 Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) case. The appellant, Sukh Dev Sodhi, has moved the Supreme Court challenging the order of the High Court which had dismissed his appeal under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.
